did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: Bud Titsworth Commercials 1968-1991 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: C. Dayton Bud Titsworth was an executive at Lord, Geller, Federico, Einstein, a subsidiary of the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) advertising agency, in the 1970s and 1980s, before starting his own agency.

The Bud Titsworth Commercials collection span the years 1968-1991 and consist of audio tapes, videocassettes and 16mm films of radio spots and television commercials on which Titsworth worked. Clients represented include Canada Dry, IBM, STP and Warner-Lambert. Announcers for radio spots include sportscaster Howard Cosell. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
In addition, original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Research Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Bud Titsworth Commercials, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Bud Titsworth Commercials were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession 2009-0093 is described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

chronitem.event: Born Charles Dayton Titsworth, Greenwich, Conn.
Marketing and Research Departments, Young & Rubicam
Account Executive, Ted Bates and Company
Account Representative, later Account Manager, J. Walter Thompson Company; later Senior Vice President, Lord, Geller, Federico, Einstein, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Bud Titsworth Commercials collection span the years 1968-1991 and consist of audio tapes, videocassettes and 16mm films of radio spots and television commercials on which Titsworth worked. Clients represented include Canada Dry, IBM, STP and Warner-Lambert. Announcers for radio spots include sportscaster Howard Cosell.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
